text: Nizhny Tsasuchey () is a rural locality (a selo) and the administrative center of Ononsky District of Zabaykalsky Krai, Russia. Population: ==Geography== The village is about 245 km southeast of the regional capital Chita. It is on the right bank of the Onon River. The Ononsky Museum of Local History is located here.Nizhny Tsasuchey in the Encyclopedia Transbaikaliens (Russian) ==History== Nizhny Tsasuchey was founded as a border outpost in 1727. By 1923, there was a three-year parochial school, a veterinary post, a nunnery, a bakery, and a horse farm. In 1927, the Komsomol cell was founded. Until the 1990s, the airport operated. ==References== Category:Rural localities in Zabaykalsky Krai
title: Nizhny Tsasuchey
